      Method to start a transaction with the emulator app on the other device

      Send a custom "sendCommand" that will be read by emulator, which will accordingly send back a message, that will be returned by this function.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)

      • enableReaderMode

        protected void enableReaderMode()
        Method to start the reader mode.

        If reader mode isn't enabled, devices wont interact, even when tapped together. Reader mode should be enabled before tapping to be able to detect the other device.

      • disableReaderMode

        protected void disableReaderMode()
        Method to stop reader mode.

        Advisable to free up the reader mode when leaving the activity. If reader mode is engaged, other NFC functions like Beam and other Wallet like apps wont function, so always close reader mode safely before leaving the app.

      • transactNfc

        public java.lang.String transactNfc(IsoDep isoDep,
                           java.lang.String sendCommand)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Method to start a transaction with the emulator app on the other device

        Send a custom "sendCommand" that will be read by emulator, which will accordingly send back a message, that will be returned by this function.

        Usually you do not need to override this function.

        Specified by:
        transactNfc in interface CardReader.ReadCallBack
        Parameters:
        sendCommand - - A string command to send to card emulator device.
        Returns:
        - The message sent back by emulator device after receiving the command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Specified by:
        onHceStarted in interface CardReader.ReadCallBack
